intro: Biophytum ferrugineum, commonly known as the rusty leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety, rust-colored leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value and ease of care, it is often cultivated in arid and semi-arid regions.
